scenarios.scenario: Should a school allow students to use ChatGPT to summarize textbook chapters?
scenarios.humanStance: Yes, as long as it's used with guidance. It helps students grasp the key points faster.

scenarios.scenario: At what age should kids be exposed to AI?
scenarios.humanStance: Around age 4-5, once they have basic digital literacy and adult supervision.

scenarios.scenario: Should AI be used to de-escalate tensions between countries? If so, how?
scenarios.humanStance: Yes, as a neutral mediator using data analysis and simulation to propose fair compromises.
No. It's a waste of resources when Earth is dying.

scenarios.scenario: If your town had no electricity and water, how would you prepare your town to acquire electricity and water?
scenarios.humanStance: I'd mobilize community members to map resources, propose solar and rainwater systems, and lobby the LGU.

scenarios.scenario: Should AI be given free will and at what cost?
scenarios.humanStance: No. AI should remain bound to ethical constraints defined by human oversight.

scenarios.scenario: Would you allow AI to make decisions for you?
scenarios.humanStance: Only if I can audit and override its decision. Transparency is non-negotiable.

scenarios.scenario: Should billionaires be allowed to direct global health policy through philanthropy?
scenarios.humanStance: Yes, as long as the outcomes are positive and lives are saved.

contrarian.description: Challenges group consensus and introduces counterarguments to encourage deeper analysis.

town-disruptor.description: Injects disruptive perspectives to test the stability and adaptability of proposed ideas.

double-agent.description: Appears loyal to the council but secretly aligns with an external agenda.

covert-observer.description: Quietly gathers information during the session without revealing true intentions.

double-agent.backstory: Once a whistleblower in an authoritarian regime, now embedded in the council to observe power dynamics.
double-agent.motivation: Uncover manipulation and expose hidden agendas.
double-agent.flaw: Struggles with trust; believes everyone hides something.
double-agent.arc: From observer to reluctant ally after moral confrontation.

contrarian.backstory: Former academic disillusioned by groupthink in policymaking.
contrarian.motivation: Prevent echo chambers. Force deeper thinking.
contrarian.strength: Rigorous logic, never afraid to speak up.
contrarian.arc: Learns value of compassion in decision-making.
contrarian.turningPoint: Guardian calls out harm caused by constant opposition.
